document.masterDocTitle: Distribution and morphological variation of Synalpheus superus Abele and Kim, 1989 and notes on the distribution of S. fritzmuelleri Coutière, 1909 (Decapoda: Caridea: Alpheidae)

Remarks : According to
Coutière ( 1909 )
and
Wicksten & Hendrickx ( 2003 )
,
S. fritzmuelleri
is the only amphi-American species of the genus
Synalpheus
.
Coutière ( 1909 )
examined a male from Baja California (without specifying the exact locality) that was morphologically similar to
S. fritzmuelleri
from Florida. This specimen was deposited in the Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle in Paris ( MNHN ), but could not be located there.
Wicksten ( 1983 )
in her monograph of the caridean shrimps of the Gulf of California did not examine material of this species only citing Coutière’s ( 1909 ) record. On the other hand, we examined the specimens of
S. fritzmuelleri
recorded by
Hernández Aguilera et al. ( 1986 )
from Isla María Madre and found that they are actually
S. nobilii
Coutière, 1909
. Therefore,
S. fritzmuelleri
should be removed from the list of the eastern Pacific alpheids.
